Text: Enron et al v CalPX Funding MotionToday Judge Collins granted the Debtors motion to permit the Debtor to draw upon the settlement accounts The Court basically adopted all of Debtors arguments in its tentative ruling A copy of the Judges tentative ruling which she said will be signed as an order of the Court will follow via email shortly Please contact me or Marc Cohen if you have any questions Bryant S Delgadillo Esq KAYE SCHOLER LLP Avenue of the Stars Suite Los Angeles CA Direct dial Direct fax Email

CalPX Hearing before Judge Kuhl re Ex parteYesterday George Caplan and I attended a hearing before Judge Kuhl on the Committees ex parte application shortening time to hear its motion to enforce the stipulation with the state regarding rejection of the claims before the VCB After hearing brief argument the Judge made it very clear that the State needed to sign the stipulation In fact the Judge waited around all day until the State signed a stipulation which will be submitted to the VCB shortly whereby the State agreed that the consolidated claims pending before the VCB should be summarily rejected as unduly complex and that all administrative remedies regarding the inverse condemnation claims on the commandeered contracts have been exhausted The Judge however was reluctant to enter our proposed order which declared that the VCB proceedings were moot and that the parties no longer needed to participate in those proceedings Please call if you have any questions Bryant S Delgadillo Esq KAYE SCHOLER LLP Avenue of the Stars Suite Los Angeles CA Direct dial Direct fax Email
